references.paper_title: Mastering the game of go without human knowledge
references.reason: This paper is foundational to the field of deep reinforcement learning, showing the capabilities of RL agents in complex environments.

references.paper_title: Mastering Atari, Go, chess and shogi by planning with a learned model
references.reason: This paper demonstrates the power of combining reinforcement learning with advanced planning techniques to achieve superhuman performance in diverse games.
This book provides a comprehensive overview of the core concepts and algorithms of reinforcement learning, serving as a fundamental textbook for the field.

references.paper_title: Optimal best arm identification with fixed confidence
references.reason: This paper provides foundational results on best arm identification, a crucial problem in the exploration-exploitation tradeoff that is also fundamental to best policy identification.
This paper introduces the concept of reward-free exploration, a setting where the agent explores without a specific reward function, relevant to the multi-reward setting discussed in this paper.
